dismissable_rag_modal.description: You can now chat with your own documents using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). Here's how it works:

attach_files.title: Attach Files
attach_files.description: Upload up to 5 files at a time, with a maximum combined size of 30MB. Supported formats include PDF, DOCX, TXT, and CSV.

be_specific.title: Be Specific
be_specific.description: When asking questions, mention as many details as possible. This helps the system retrieve the most relevant information from your documents.

get_responses.title: Get Responses and Experiment
get_responses.description: The LLM will look at your query and the retrieved excerpts from your documents, and attempt to generate a response. Experiment with different queries to find what works best.

step_0.title: Tool use has landed! üõ†Ô∏è
step_0.text_0: Tool use enable applications to empower LLMs with external tools and services. You can think of it like giving the LLM a toolbox of functions it can use when needed.
step_0.text_1: With tool use, you can build applications where LLMs not only understand and respond, but take actions - like searching the web, analyzing data, controlling smart home devices, or interacting with any API.
step_0.text_2: The possibilities are endless - if you can write a function for it, an LLM can intelligently use it.

step_1.title: How do I get started?
step_1.toolUseCanWorkWithAnyModel: All models are compatible with tool use in LM Studio. However, models with `native` tool use support will generally perform better. Read the <customlink>documentation</customlink> to learn more. These models will be marked with a new badge:
step_1.hasCompatibleModel: You have models with `native` support already downloaded! Select one to get started:
step_1.downloadRecommendedModel: Download your first `native` tool use model:
